definition: henpecked/to be under one's wife's thumb
surname Pa
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
grandmother/matron/mother-in-law/(slang) femme (in a lesbian relationship)

sentences.english: We often chaff him for his fear of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常拿他的怕老婆開玩笑。

sentences.english: John is hen -pecked husband if there ever was one . His wife almost never lets him out of her sight .
sentences.chinese: 約翰非常怕老婆，他太太幾乎不讓他離開她的視線。

sentences.english: Henpecked husbands should, however, steer clear of having a row mid-afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 然而，怕老婆的丈夫應該避免在午後和老婆發生爭吵。

sentences.english: The trouble with you is you"re too hen-pecked."
sentences.chinese: 最糟糕的是你太怕老婆了。

sentences.english: His wife tracking Sister wang follow Lao zhang, afraid of wife of Lao zhang hurriedly slip away.
sentences.chinese: 王姐追隨老張而來，怕老婆的老張趕緊溜走。
他是個典型的怕老婆丈夫。

sentences.english: Coward henpecked, my wife always says before a stranger afraid of him.
sentences.chinese: 膽小鬼怕老婆，在外人面前總說老婆怕他。

sentences.english: He's been hen-pecked for the past 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 他在過去的20年中一直很怕老婆。

sentences.english: Are you a person who is afraid of wife?
sentences.chinese: 你是一個怕老婆的人嗎？

sentences.english: John is a hen-pecked husband if there over was one. His wife almost never lets him out of her sight.
sentences.chinese: 約翰非常怕老婆，他太太幾乎不讓他離開她的視線。

sentences.english: People refer the man who was afraid of his wife as henpecked.
sentences.chinese: 人們把那個怕老婆的男人叫“妻管嚴”。
